segment.source: How to Validate the MBAM Installation with Configuration Manager
segment.target: How to Validate the MBAM Installation with Configuration Manager

segment.source: How to Validate the MBAM Installation with Configuration Manager
segment.target: How to Validate the MBAM Installation with Configuration Manager

segment.source: How to Validate the MBAM Installation with Configuration Manager
segment.target: How to Validate the MBAM Installation with Configuration Manager

segment.source: After installing Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with Configuration Manager, validate that the installation has successfully set up all the necessary features for MBAM by completing the following steps.
segment.target: After installing Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) with Configuration Manager, validate that the installation has successfully set up all the necessary features for MBAM by completing the following steps.

segment.source: To validate the MBAM Server feature installation with Configuration Manager
segment.target: To validate the MBAM Server feature installation with Configuration Manager

segment.source: On the server where System Center Configuration Manager is deployed, open Control Panel.
segment.target: On the server where System Center Configuration Manager is deployed, open Control Panel.

segment.source: Select the program that is used to uninstall or change a program.
segment.target: Select the program that is used to uninstall or change a program.

segment.source: Verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears in the list of programs and features.
segment.target: Verify that Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring appears in the list of programs and features.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To validate the installation, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.
segment.target: To validate the installation, you must use a domain account that has local computer administrative credentials on each server.

segment.source: Use the Configuration Manager console to confirm that a new collection, called “MBAM Supported Computers,” is displayed.
segment.target: Use the Configuration Manager console to confirm that a new collection, called “MBAM Supported Computers,” is displayed.

segment.source: To view the collection with Configuration Manager 2007: Click Site Database (SiteCodeServerName, SiteName), Computer Management.
segment.target: To view the collection with Configuration Manager 2007: Click Site Database (SiteCodeServerName, SiteName), Computer Management.

segment.source: To view the collection with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager: Click the Assets and Compliance workspace, Device Collections.
segment.target: To view the collection with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager: Click the Assets and Compliance workspace, Device Collections.

segment.source: Use the Configuration Manager console to verify that the following reports are listed in the MBAM folder:
segment.target: Use the Configuration Manager console to verify that the following reports are listed in the MBAM folder:

segment.source: BitLocker Computer Compliance
segment.target: BitLocker Computer Compliance

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Dashboard

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Details

segment.source: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary
segment.target: BitLocker Enterprise Compliance Summary

segment.source: To view the reports with Configuration Manager 2007: Click Reporting, Reporting Services, ServerName, Report Folders
segment.target: To view the reports with Configuration Manager 2007: Click Reporting, Reporting Services, ServerName, Report Folders

segment.source: To view the reports with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager: Click the Monitoring workspace, Reporting, Reports.
segment.target: To view the reports with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager: Click the Monitoring workspace, Reporting, Reports.

segment.source: Use the Configuration Manager console to confirm that the configuration baseline “BitLocker Protection” is listed.
segment.target: Use the Configuration Manager console to confirm that the configuration baseline “BitLocker Protection” is listed.

segment.source: To view the configuration baselines with Configuration Manager 2007: Click Desired Configuration Management, Configuration Baselines.
segment.target: To view the configuration baselines with Configuration Manager 2007: Click Desired Configuration Management, Configuration Baselines.

segment.source: To view the configuration baselines with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager: Click the Assets and Compliance workspace, Compliance Settings, Configuration Baselines.
segment.target: To view the configuration baselines with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager: Click the Assets and Compliance workspace, Compliance Settings, Configuration Baselines.

segment.source: Use the Configuration Manager console to confirm that that the following new configuration items are displayed:
segment.target: Use the Configuration Manager console to confirm that that the following new configuration items are displayed:

segment.source: BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection
segment.target: BitLocker Fixed Data Drives Protection

segment.source: BitLocker Operating System Drive Protection
segment.target: BitLocker Operating System Drive Protection

segment.source: To view the configuration items with Configuration Manager 2007: Click Desired Configuration Management, Configuration Items.
segment.target: To view the configuration items with Configuration Manager 2007: Click Desired Configuration Management, Configuration Items.

segment.source: To view the configuration items with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager: Click the Assets and Compliance workspace, Compliance Settings, Configuration Items.
segment.target: To view the configuration items with System Center 2012 Configuration Manager: Click the Assets and Compliance workspace, Compliance Settings, Configuration Items.

segment.target: Related topics
